text.wmch.title: Where's My Chat History Configuration
text.wmch.dateFormat: For date and time formatting information, click me!
text.wmch.formatCodes: For formatting code characters and which ones do what, click me!
text.wmch.desc.time: Should a timestamp in front of all messages show?
text.wmch.desc.timeDate: The text that is formatted into a timestamp.
text.wmch.desc.timeFormat: The string of '&'s + formatting codes and decoration text that create the timestamp. The $ is a placeholder for the formatted timestamp Option above this one.
text.wmch.desc.timeColor: The color that's filled in where it would otherwise be blank white in the resulting timestamp.
text.wmch.desc.hover: Should text appear stating a more detailed time description when you hover over the timestamp text in chat?
text.wmch.desc.hoverDate: The text that is formatted into a longer date/time string.
text.wmch.desc.hoverFormat: The string of '&'s + formatting codes and decoration text that create the detailed hover description. Requires a $ as a placeholder for the formatted timestamp Option above this one.
text.wmch.desc.hoverColor: The color that's filled in where it would otherwise be blank white in the resulting hover text.
text.wmch.desc.counter: Should a message counter show after messages to indicate multiple duplicates were sent?
text.wmch.desc.counterStr: The text that's added to the end of a message to indicate multiple duplicates were sent. Requires a $ for the number of duplicates, also supports '&'s + formatting codes to modify it.
text.wmch.desc.counterColor: The color that's filled in where it would otherwise be blank white in the resulting duplicate counter.
text.wmch.desc.boundary: Should a boundary line show after chatting, leaving a world/server, and then joining another world/server later?
text.wmch.desc.boundaryStr: The text that is formatted and used for the boundary line. Supports '&' + formatting codes to modify it.
text.wmch.desc.boundaryColor: The color that's filled in where it would otherwise be blank white in the resulting boundary line.
text.wmch.desc.saveChat: Should the chat be saved into a log so it can be re-added back into the chat in another game session?
text.wmch.desc.shiftChat: Shifts the chat interface up to not obstruct the armor bar and/or health. Default is 10, set to 0 for no shift.
text.wmch.desc.maxMsgs: The max amount of chat messages allowed to render. Vanilla is capped at 100, the true maximum is 32767. Keep in mind the higher the number, the more memory the chat will require to store all the messages.
text.wmch.desc.nameFormat: The text that replaces the playername in chat messages. Vanilla is <$>, no triangle brackets is $; where $ is a placeholder for the playername. Only applies to player sent messages.
text.wmch.mixin.incompatible:
This Option is disabled because one or more of the mods listed are installed: %s
Regardless of which mod(s) are installed, they all have at least one conflicting mixins or methods which break the method(s) that make this Option function.
